channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report X-2024060392
item.description:
Report X-2024060392

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was not processed HAP and put it in the Yellow Hazmat salvage drum. There is no indication of package being processed as HAZMAT from the origin station and arrived to the destination station to be delivered for recipient in yellow Hazmat salvage drum. The Hazmat package have OK to load sticker on the package. Upon inspection of the package the cap is loose and leaking.

item.title: Report E-2024060498
item.description:
Report E-2024060498

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) quarts of material released from two (2) 5-gallon plastic pails impacting the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the damaged pails and spent cleanup debris into two (2) 20-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060497
item.description:
Report E-2024060497

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: CONNERSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: while unloading drums into warehouse the closure ring for an open head drum of paint related material was not on correctly. When the fork truck with drum clips went to pick up the drum the lid popped off and material spilled. no material went offsite, and the material was cleaned up in house and properly managed.

item.title: Report X-2024061153
item.description:
Report X-2024061153

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE RATTLE AEROSOL SOUND HEARD COMING FROM THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE X 24 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE SPRUH KONIG COVERING LACQUER. THE INNER BOX IS MARKED AND LABELED UN1950, AEROSOLS, FLAMMABLE WITH A 2.1 FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD SHIPPING BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024061130
item.description:
Report X-2024061130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: CENTERVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOADER FOUND WET PACKAGE IN TRAILER, NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO HAD A RESPONDER DON PPE, AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DAMAGE PROCESSING AREA. RESPONDER CLERK DONNED PPEIDENTIFIED CONTENTS AND FOLLOWING THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET(S) PROCESSED THE PACKAGE INTO A SPILL BUCKET TO BE PICKED UP AT A LATER DATE.
